Reviews.Content: hated the hotel and all Amesterdam because of this Hotel poor maintinance,bad smell all over the hotel, breakfast is basic of poor quality, some of the stuff are so agressive and are in the wrong position. The website does not match with the reality. some authority has to stop the sheeting.The only good thing is the place where it is located. it is close to central station. if you do not care about smells, respect, food, furnisher...this is your place.
Reviews.Author: Graber

Reviews.Content: Terrible Place! Don't stay there. They tried to charge us double from what they quoted on the internet. The first room they put us in was sub standard, lights hanging of the wall or not working, tiny room. The second room was not much better. I would look for another hotel don't stay there. Just down the street there is a hotel info shop on Prinshenrikslade. Go there.....there is a nice woman who can fix you up with a good hotel last minute @ cheap prices.
Reviews.Author: mungo1

Reviews.Content: Faulty towers This has to be the worst hotel I've ever had the misfortune to stay in. It was dirty nothing worked i.e. WC's shower the staff weren't overly helpful although one or two tried their best. We had a quad room with only one door key which made coming and going difficult, one lad had to climb in through the window! Despite me asking several times if they could fix are broken shower nothing was ever done about it, Several of our group were in the basement which was cold and flooded during the rain. The hotel isn鈥檛 cheap and what you get for your money is very poor quality, I鈥檇 never stay here again hopefully someone night read this review before booking and not bother! The official website has some very clearly taken photos to make the place look mint but I can tell you it鈥檚 not it鈥檚 run down dirty and in need of a total refurbishment. We travelled home on a ferry and the tiny cabin was like a five star penthouse suite compared the room we got!Oh well at least Amsterdam is a belting city so you wont have to spend much time in this establishment!
Reviews.Author: munkaM/cr

Reviews.Content: Grim Good points: Location good, near centre and train station. Breakfast reasonable.Bad points: Our room had a dirty dusty carpet, smelt strongly of stale cigarettes, curtain only covered 60% of window, mirror was on floor, toilet did not work, toilet door handle broken, only one light bulb out of three worked. No ladder for bunk bed. Fire doors did not close. Cleaners left our door open.We would not recommend this hotel
Reviews.Author: JoepublicLondon

Reviews.Content: Not the Ritz, but not bad Having booked the hotel prior to reading these reviews we were a little concerned. Upon arrival the manager (apparently) apologised for our room as it was the worst in the hotel, and promised to move us the following day if we asked. This further scared us! However the room was fine, the bed was comfortable, everything was clean and worked so we were quite happy to use it as a base.When we returned after an afternoon in the cafe's of Amsterdam we found that all our stuff had been moved to the best room in the hotel (according to the staff!) Which we hadnt asked for, but was a nice surprise.Some of the staff are a little surly and rude, but the bottom line is that the hotel was fine as a base to explore the wonders of Amsterdam!
Reviews.Author: stuwilky

Reviews.Content: alright What you see is what you get, we had 30 lads on a trip. It provided a bed and thats about it, showers are [----], flood everywhere. Not the cleanest in the worldYou can do much better than this place but its fine for stags etc
Reviews.Author: den_ireland

Reviews.Content: simple but clean hotel After reading the other comments I was really thinking if I should stay in this hotel, but Amsterdam was full most places have been fully booked.This is a very simple hotel my room was small but clean.The restaurant looked new and nice.This hotel does need more care, but what do you expect from a simple hotel? The stuff was friendly and helpfull.
Reviews.Author: nicetime

Reviews.Content: What a shocker!! This has to be the absolute worst hotel I have stayed in (and I have travelled extensively). It was filthy dirty, the staff were unorganised, the room was horrible, the carpets were filthy and damp, the room very very small, and faced onto a very busy street. The windows didnt open more than 6 inches, the room was very stuffy and unpleasant. The bathroom was a horror storey, its stank of human waste, the shower flooded (even though the water dribbled out). The bed linen was dirty and the bed barely held together for the duration of our stay. The location is ok, but atleast 10 mins to the square. It was completely overpriced. I would not recommend this place to anyone, avoid it like the plague! HORROR!!!!!
Reviews.Author: London32

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel Ever I cannot believe that this hotel is rated as a 3-star - any pictures you see online are misleading! We had a horrible stay for so many reasons. Our room was filthy - the carpet was extremely dirty (we could see stains and it was sticky), the paint was coming off the walls, dustbunnies filled every corner. We requested for a non-smoking room but could smell smoke from the surrounding areas. Our bathroom smelled like chlorine (which could mean that it was sanitized but was nonetheless unimpressive) and was poorly lit. The staff was not particularly friendly and there was not phone in our room. But it gets WORSE... we woke up with bites on our face, arms and legs because of BEDBUGS! The only positive points are location to the central trainstation (which you can get elsewhere) and cable. Not only would I not recommend anyone to stay here, I would totally advise against it. Save your money - find a different hotel!
Reviews.Author: Angela_GradStudent

Reviews.Content: Good Choice We have just got back from Amsterdam after staying at Hotel Y Boulevard. After booking we checked this site to find horrible reviews. Needless to say we considered cancelling the rooms. Limited choice made us stick with the hotel and I am glad we did. There was a group of 6 of us and none of us have any complaints about the hotel. The rooms were clean, dry and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was perfect for the whole city. We had a brilliant time and I will definiately recommend this hotel to other people in the future.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cheap  Having read the reviews was expecting the worst, but was pleasantly surprise, our room looked out over the harbour and was clean and warm. The staff where great, and the breakfast plentiful. Good location,could have done with tea and coffee making facilities.But I,ve paid a lot more to stay in worse places,
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Worst ever!!!!!! Stayed here during congress week for a weekend in september 2005 the place is an absolute dive we were given a basement room which was absolutely humming of damp so bad that we kept extractor fan in the bathroom on whilst we were out but to no avail!!! the carpet in the room was so dirty you actually stuck to it!!!I have travelled round India twice and i can honestlysay this is the worst hotel/guest house that ive ever Stayed in. Dont touch it with a bargepole!!!!
Reviews.Author: paoloc

Reviews.Content: pleasantly surprised!!!!!! hello!!!! just got back yesterday from this hotel, stayed there with my gfriend last wed - sat and having read the reviews on here which i feel are harsh!so thought id add what i thought!!! basically the location was good - opposite the floating chinese restaurant (the food there is great), and the nemo museum (which again is wicked fun), and a short walking distant from everything.Ive given it 4 stars based on the fact that our room was clean, not small, we had hot water all the time, it didnt smell, the sheets were clean, we had fresh towels everyday, and cable tv with 30 channels.....although we dont speak dutch but we had bbc1 and 2!!so i got to c motd!we were on the top floor and it was 3 flights of steep stairs but all buildings in amsterdam are like this!!!! the bed was very comfy and next door unintentionally entertained us on the first might as the walls were thin....er...the breakfast was ok - juice / tea and coffee and toast, croissants, cereal , meat,cheese etc so not bad!who doesnt like toast!!the food we had (pizza) from the restaurant was freshly made/cooked and delicious!and the bar was reasonable.so in conclusion good value. amsterdam isnt cheap but the staff were very friendly and helpful! the place is nicely decorated and we had a good time!
Reviews.Author: truthordare

Reviews.Content: location good..the rest bad.. When arriving at the hotel I thought it looked quite nice from the outside,it was all downhill from there, I heard the horror stories of having to spend the night in a sweaty stinky, rodent infested basement room. Well my nightmare was quickly realised as this was to be our room for 4 nights.The beds were rickety with yellow stains on them, the guy cleaning said it was water, there was no plug for the sink (hello), when you showered the whole floor would get flooded, and the smell of the room, my god Ive washed my clothes twice and they still stink of this place. O.K it was cheap and the location was great but theres got to be better alternatives, I saw a chap huddled into a doorway and thought shall we check out and do that instead..Overalll then not a good experience, it totally spoiled my visit.Im a down to earth guy from a working class background and am not used to the riches of the ritz etc..this place is a dump...DO NOT GO THERE..
Reviews.Author: stickysativa

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for Stayed here in January 2005. The place was being redecorated while we were there but just the main reception area and outside, there were no paint fumes in our room. It's a very keenly priced hotel and the room was not fantastic but it was kept clean and tidy. If you're just after somewhere to sleep (like we were) then I'd recommend it as it's in a very good location a few minutes walk from the train station and the centre of Amsterdam and you can't argue with the price. If you're after luxury then give it a miss but if you're travelling on a budget and want to be near the centre then it's great. The staff were always very friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: just coming back from The hague We stayed there for a couple of nights. Rooms are basic but clean. Dont expect a sea view as some of the rooms are in a downstaris floor. Breakfast, even a bit plain is cool to have in the main lounge next to the sea. OVerall is ok. Right location next to the tram and right to the beach
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It's a dump This place is a dump, we booked a room online and travelled in October 2003. Tried 2 rooms, 1 in the basement and 1 on the first floor. Bed sheets dirty, light switches falling off, bathroom smelling, carpet sticky, absolutely filthy. We done budget travel before but this place was completely unacceptable. We refused to stay and got our money back, went to a hotel booking agency down the road and got a room at the Amsterdam Hilton for the same price as this dump was charging us. A good tip if you are on a short stay and it is the weekend, the chains such as hilton are empty and are giving the rooms away, just go to one of the hotel booking agencies and they will have deals that compare with the budget hotels.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It was ok If your looking to stay in the lap of luxuary then there is no point in even looking at this hotel but if your not really too fussed about how you stay then this is the perfect place to stay. The hotel is clean the staff are helpful and the room i stayed in was ok.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not that bad! I have just come back from staying in the Y Boulevard. My room was alright but what can you expect for such a cheap hotel? I stayed there with a friend and it worked out about 22 euros each a night. There are some bad points but when you are travelling on a budget its a pretty good deal. The breakfast isnt bad, yes ham and chesse, but also hard boiled eggs and cornflakes and plenty of fruit juices. The room wasnt bad, we were in the basement we didnt have a view at all but we werent expecting one. It was very basic but if you bring your own towel and aren't fussed over a lack in some of the usual hotel standards you will be quite content there. We didnt interact much with the staff but when we did they seemed alright. All in all you get what you pay for. If you are too used to posh hotels and arent willing to ruff it a bit then you probably arent in the right city to begin with. All in all I enjoyed my stay and would go back. I saved quite alot staying there and put the money to good use in Amsterdam!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel from hell On first impression the front looked scruffy, the hall way was dark and damp, reception and bar looked clean but empty.The room on second floor looked out onto scaffolding and empty houses, the room smelt of damp, mold all over walls of room and in bathroom, light swithces fall off in hand and carpets patched and curtains hanging off rails, an unwelcome feel to the whole hotel.We refused to stay the night we felt it would be better for our health to loose the money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice view from the upper rooms.. Cheap, not far from the city centre and not that bad at all. I'm more used to more expensive hotels but this one was quite all right. The staff was unfriendly that's true, but there room was clean, the breakfast was all right and from te top floor we had a nice view from the Nemo building to the Centraal station. Good for a short stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Y Boulevard More hostel than hotel, the staff were unhelpful and sometimes unfriendly. Outside, the hotel looks nice, and the reception area is attractive, but this was undermined by the empty bar, and unappealing breakfasts of ham and cheese. The rooms were mainly small and stuffy (some looked more like closets), and there were only hand towels in the en-suite shower-room. The owners didn't keep essential items on hand such as toilet rolls and spare light bulbs.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Y Boulevard This was the worst hotel I have ever set foot in. It was that bad I didn't even ask to see the room. Set in a dingy, dirty area of Amsterdam within a short distance of Central Station, you would not send your dog to it for a break.The hotel front is completely unwelcoming, the entrance hall is dark and dirty, reminiscent of a smoky coffee shop, nothing appealing whatsoever.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
